results.title: The Cup and the lip
results.creator_credit: Joanna Robinski, Bruno de Villenoisy and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A difficult child and a good mother. A loose tooth, a sign on a wall, an imaginary word, ecstasy, anger… A disturbing film about the ultimate taboo.
Cast: Gosia Dobrowolska, Julian Barta
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joanna Robinski, Bruno de Villenoisy and AFTRS

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS

results.title: Around the world in 80 days
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC
results.brief_description: Complete with visas, running shoes, an inflatable globe and sound advice from Alan Whicker, Michael Palin set off to circumnavigate the world using only forms of transport available to the fictional Phileas Fogg. His Passepartout was a 5-strong film crew, his journey was phenomenal, his deadline was 80 days. -
results.description: Complete with visas, running shoes, an inflatable globe and sound advice from Alan Whicker, Michael Palin set off to circumnavigate the world using only forms of transport available to the fictional Phileas Fogg. His Passepartout was a 5-strong film crew, his journey was phenomenal, his deadline was 80 days. -

His Passepartout was a 5-strong film crew, his journey was phenomenal, his deadline was 80 days. -

results.title: Homeward bound
results.creator_credit: Clem Vallance, Roger Mills, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
Homeward bound covers days 28 to 79 of Michael Palin’s (ex- Monty Python) 20th Century attempt to replicate the round-the-world trip of the fictional Phineas Fogg. The video takes us with Michael from Madras to Singapore via a Yugoslav freighter on which Palin works as a deckhand; from Singapore to Hong Kong and Shanghai, where Palin samples snake; from Shanghai to California via the eerie uninhabited world of a giant container ship and then by train, dog sled, balloon and ship on the last leg back to London.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clem Vallance, Roger Mills, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV

results.title: The Creepy Crawley's
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Beck Cole and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The Creepy Crawleys, a documentary film, is set in an isolated Australian country town and tells the story of Monte Cristo, a mysterious old mansion and its owners, past and present.
Contains b&w archival stills.

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
In this the first half of his journey, Michael Palin travels from London to Madras, via Venice, Alexandria, Saudi Arabia, Dubai and Bombay. Dropping further and further behind schedule Palin struggles with missed connections, bureaucratic negotiations and seasickness until, after a quick shave by a blind man with a cut-throat blade, he boards the train to Madras, only to find his seat has been given to three different Michael Palins, one of them a woman!
results.description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
In this the first half of his journey, Michael Palin travels from London to Madras, via Venice, Alexandria, Saudi Arabia, Dubai and Bombay. results.title: Cherish
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Stephen Jones and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“What peace is there for us whose best love cannot return them even for a day? …..The last word was yours.” (Jeannette Winterson ‘Written on the Body’)
A poetic and tender story celebrating life, love and death.
Cast: John Adam, Russell Page

results.title: Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Jessica Cribb, Rebecca Parker and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. They live in Willmot, an isolated community on the outskirts of Western Sydney. It’s a no-go zone, a suburban wasteland with huge powerlines overhead. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.
results.description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.

Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.

results.title: Bias
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Steve Pasvolsky, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Two old men are playing for the champion’s rosette in lawn bowls when a snail interupts play and causes one codger to win and the other to lose. The battle takes on a greater moral dimension…Animation and live action.
Cast: Lisle Jones, John Keightley

results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Jason Ramp and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
